$description: Design Token Context Ontology - Meta definitions

volatility.$description: Classification of how frequently dimension values change

immutable.$description: Fixed for entire session; set at initialization. Scope: Application

stable.$description: Changes only through explicit user action in settings. Scope: User session

semi-stable.$description: May change during session but infrequently. Scope: Page/view

volatile.$description: Changes frequently during normal interaction. Scope: Component

inherited.$description: Derived from ancestor context, not set directly. Scope: Subtree

inferred.$description: Automatically detected via platform APIs (media queries, JS APIs)

declared.$description: Explicitly set by application or component

layers.$description: Token architecture layers with unidirectional dependencies

context.$description: Environment layer: viewport, platform, locale. Detected automatically, read-only

preference.$description: User settings layer: prefers-*, density, accessibility. User-controllable

semantic.$description: Design intent layer: status, emphasis, intent. Author-defined

state.$description: Interaction layer: interaction, combinable states. Runtime-dynamic

component.$description: Implementation layer: component-specific tokens. References semantic only

1-accessibility.$description: Accessibility overrides: forced-colors, prefers-contrast, minimum targets
